Source code (Git)

The project repositories are at the Apache Software Foundation (see ASF Writable Git Services homepage), and are also mirrored on Github. Using the Github repo is certainly the easiest for most. For those with direct write access to source code, note that the Github repo is writable (not just a read-only mirror anymore), as far as your Apache account and Github accounts are linked.

The key repositories are:

  • freemarker: The engine itself (i.e., freemarker.jar) and the documentation. URL: https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf/freemarker.git. GitHub mirror: https://github.com/apache/freemarker. Relevant branches (as of 2015-09-04):

    • 2.3-gae: FreeMarker 2.3.x Google App Engine compliant variant. Develop here by default! This is where most developments are committed, and are then merged into the other two branches below.

    • 2.3: FreeMarker 2.3.x, "normal" variant (this is what most users use). We hardly ever commit into this directly, instead changes are coming from2.3-gae via merging.

    • 3: FreeMarker 3.x.x. The next generation of FreeMarker, heavily under development. More about FreeMarker 3...

  • freemarker-site: Web site (freemarker.apache.org) contents. URL: https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf/freemarker-site.git. GitHub mirror: https://github.com/apache/freemarker-site. Relevant branches: master

  • freemarker-docgen: DocBook transformation used for generating both the FreeMarker Manual and the Web site. URL: https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf/freemarker-docgen.git. GitHub mirror: https://github.com/apache/freemarker-docgen. Relevant branches: master

  • freemarker-online-tester: The service behind https://try.freemarker.apache.org/. URL: https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf/freemarker-online-tester.git. GitHub mirror: https://github.com/apache/freemarker-online-tester. Relevant branches: master
